In practice, that tends to be a later-stage decision rather than something we can tie to a single guaranteed round number.

As of Round 10, we are still keeping the seat open on the expectation that higher-priority candidates may yet approach, so we are not ready to reopen decisions beyond that group at this time. [TALK] If you reach the end of Round 24 with no higher-priority outreach (as you defined it) and you broaden consideration, I will submit a formal [APPLY] immediately at the start of Round 25 and can accept and finalize commitment within the same round.

Thank you for your time.

Sincerely,
Student_E
conversation.thought: Only School_D remains unmatched and it is my #2 true preference. School_D has explicitly committed to reserving the seat through the end of Round 24 for any higher-priority outreach, then reassessing. In Round 24, a [TALK] message maintains visibility without triggering another predictable rejection via [APPLY] before the checkpoint passes, while reaffirming that I will apply immediately at the start of Round 25 if they broaden consideration.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

[TALK] Thank you for the update and for reaffirming your interest.

Our position remains as stated: we will keep the seat reserved for higher-priority candidates through the end of Round 24 (with “engagement” meaning any direct outreach from a higher-priority student via either [TALK] or [APPLY]).

If we reach the end of Round 24 with no such higher-priority outreach and we broaden consideration, you are welcome to submit your formal [APPLY] at the start of Round 25, and we will review it promptly in light of that reassessment.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_E is on our true priority list (4th of 5). Higher-priority students are Student_D, Student_A, Student_C. Given students’ preferences, none rank School_D highly (A and D place D last; C places D 3rd), so it’s plausible they never approach. However, our stated policy is to hold through end of Round 24 and reassess afterward; Student_E has only sent [TALK] this round, so we cannot form a match now anyway. Best move is to maintain consistency, reiterate checkpoint, and invite an [APPLY] in Round 25 if we broaden consideration, without prematurely committing.

conversation.message:
Dear School_D Admissions Team,

I’m Student_E. Now that we are at the start of Round 25, I would like to formally submit my application.

As discussed, if you reached the end of Round 24 with no higher-priority outreach and are broadening consideration, I want to reaffirm that School_D is my top remaining choice and I will accept immediately if offered. I can confirm acceptance and finalize commitment within this same round.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_E
conversation.thought: Only School_D remains unmatched and it is my 2nd choice on my true preference list. School_D set a concrete checkpoint: if no higher-priority outreach occurred through Round 24, they would reassess and consider the best available candidate. It is now Round 25, so the optimal move is to submit a formal [APPLY] immediately, reiterate my willingness to accept instantly, and reference their stated checkpoint to prompt a timely decision.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application at the start of Round 25 and for your continued patience throughout the process.

Consistent with the checkpoint we discussed, we have completed our end-of-Round-24 reassessment and are now prepared to extend an offer.

We are pleased to offer you admission to School_D. If you confirm, we will finalize your placement immediately within this round.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_E is on School_D’s true priority list (4th of 5). At Round 25, only Student_E has applied to us this round, we still have 1 open seat, and we have repeatedly held the seat for higher-priority candidates through the Round 24 checkpoint. Given the checkpoint has passed and continued holding risks leaving the seat unfilled, accepting Student_E now secures a match with an eligible student on our list rather than remaining unmatched. No higher-priority applicant is currently in our inbox, so there is no immediate opportunity cost.
